entry.title: Paul Tudor Jones Points To Bitcoin And Gold As Shields Against US Inflation Threats
entry.summary:
Billionaire hedge fund manager Paul Tudor Jones, CEO of Tudor Investment Corporation, highlighted the growing threat of inflation in a recent interview with CNBC, describing Bitcoin and gold as essential assets amid rising recession fears in the United States.
During the interview, Jones revealed his investment strategy, stating that he is actively purchasing both Bitcoin and gold, positioning himself long in these assets, further reflecting a broader concern about the current economic landscape and the potential consequences of “unchecked government spending.”
Jones Urges Investment In Bitcoin And Gold
Jones articulated his worries about the US fiscal situation, saying, “We are going to be broke really quickly unless we get serious about dealing with our spending issues.”
Jones w…

entry.title: Stripe to Acquire Stablecoin Startup for Over $1Billion: Report
entry.summary:
Stripe plans to acquire the stablecoin infrastructure provider Bridge to strengthen its position in the fintech and crypto markets. This acquisition is estimated to be valued at $1.1 billion, Forbes reported. According to sources familiar with the matter, Stripe's purchase aims to enhance international money transfers and bolster its payment solutions for businesses globally. The company was founded by John and Patrick Collison in 2010 and has established itself in the payment processing sector, with a valuation of 65 billion earlier this year. Expanding Stablecoin Services Stripe reportedly confirmed the acquisition of Bridge, which specializes in enabling businesses to use stablecoins, cryptocurrencies pegged to traditional currencies like the US dollar, for transactions. Bridge has experienced remarkable growth, reporting a tenfold increase in business this year alone. CEO Zach Abrams noted the company's rapid expansion and its existing clientele, which includes notable firms like Coinbase and SpaceX. Bridge will reportedly serve as a Web3 version of Stripe, enabling seamless payment solutions for digital transactions worldwide. The acquisition comes at a time when digital currencies are gaining traction, largely due to recent decisions by the US Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) that have eased regulations surrounding cryptocurrencies. This shift has encouraged major companies, including PayPal, to embrace digital currencies. PayPal launched its own US dollar stablecoin last year. International Transactions Although the details about the timeline for the acquisition were not disclosed, the move could position Stripe to compete effectively in the digital finance space. By integrating Bridge's capabilities, Stripe aims to enhance its offerings and provide businesses with better solutions for international transactions. Expect ongoing updates as this story evolves.
This article was written by Jared Kirui at www.financemagnates.com.

entry.title: Boom To Bust: TON Network’s Daily Users Drop From 5 Million To 1.58-M
entry.summary:
The Open Network (TON) blockchain has significantly decreased its daily active users. According to a Twitter/X post by IntoTheBlock, the TON network currently boasts 1.58 million active users, down from a high of over 5 million.
The same post also shared a chart tracking the number of daily active addresses on the network, punctuated by highs and lows representing bull and hype runs and market corrections. IntoTheBlock asks: what conditions can potentially trigger TON’s next run?
TON’s DAU Down, But Does It Matter?
IntoTheBlock is just one analytics firm that tracks crypto’s stats, including the daily active users count (DAU). In the fast-growing crypto industry, DAU is a critical metric that can describe the status or even the future of a crypto project. We can think of the DAU as…

entry.title: Coinbase Files Dual FOIA Requests Demanding Transparency On US Crypto Crackdown
entry.summary:
On Monday, Coinbase’s Chief Legal Officer, Paul Grewal, announced that the exchange is ramping up its legal efforts in their ongoing battle with US regulators by filing two new sets of Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) requests.
Grewal emphasized the necessity of obtaining clarity on how regulatory agencies are approaching digital assets, stating, “In short, so long as the government will not relent, neither will Coinbase.”
Coinbase Aims To Reveal Crucial Regulatory Communications
The first FOIA request seeks documents relating to the cap on digital asset deposits imposed by the Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation (FDIC) and other banking regulators on financial institutions.
The second request aims to gather logs detailing how these agencies manage other FOIA requests. These ne…

entry.title: Michael Saylor’s Latest Remarks Shock The Bitcoin World: What He Said
entry.summary:
In a recent interview with journalist Madison Reidy, Michael Saylor, CEO of MicroStrategy, stirred a massive controversy within the Bitcoin community with his remarks on custody and regulation. The discussion centered around the risks associated with large institutions holding significant amounts of BTC and the potential for government seizure or confiscation, reminiscent of historical events like the gold confiscation under Executive Order 6102 in 1933.
When questioned about the risks of having a significant amount of BTC held by third-party custodians and large institutions, Saylor dismissed concerns of increased seizure or confiscation. He argued that BTC is safer in the hands of regulated public entities like BlackRock, Fidelity, and JP Morgan than with unregulated private holders. S…

entry.summary: BTC briefly dips under $59k, $160m liquidations. Mt Gox extends repayment plan by 1 year. Uniswap plans L2 for DeFi. SEC sues crypto trading firm Cumberland. Binomial sues SEC over futures trading. SEC’s Uyeda criticises agency’s policy. Justin Sun named prime minister of Liberland. MicroStrategy wants to become BTC bank. Binance pre-market trading goes live. Nearly 50% of US investors want crypto ETFs. Whale phished for $35m crypto. Ethena invests $46m in RWA funds. Trump’s crypto project aims to raise $300m.

entry.title: Decentraland Desktop Client Preview
entry.summary: Ethereum metaverse game Decentraland has shared an exclusive look at the visual and performance upgrades coming via its new desktop client.

entry.title: Crypto Trader Murad Mahmudov talks about the Supercycle and how he chooses Meme Coins.
entry.summary: Crypto Trader Murad Mahmudov talks about the Supercycle and how he chooses Meme Coins. Crypto stable, had sold off after China stocks fall. Crypto adopted faster than other tech: BlackRock. Crypto adoption to hit 8% of world population. CryptoCom recieves Wells notice from SEC. HBO documentary on Satoshi airs tonight. FTX bankruptcy plan approved by judge. Scroll airdrop may be imminent. Jupiter goes live on mobile iOS. Phantom rolls out support for Base. AAVE launches GHO on Base. Gensler may be replaced by Robinhood CLO. 87% of new token launches on SOL. National Bank of Bahrain creates BTC fund. BedRock DeFi allows BTC staking on ARB.

entry.title: Memecoins take off, funding stays low, China stocks keep on rising!
entry.summary: FOMO HOUR EP213. Memecoins take off, funding stays low, China stocks keep on rising! Many altcoins & memecoins soar despite stable BTC. Funding rates continue to be low or negative. Crypto funds saw $147m of outflows last week. BTC remains best performing major assets this year. SUI breaks into the top 20 coins again. TAO leads top 100 away from memes, sifu shorts. $100m bridge to SOL over the last 7 days. Metaplanet buys $6.7m more BTC. ETH proposal aims to improve throughput 50%. EIGEN, OP, APT lead token unlocks this week.

entry.title: How Walrus Protocol Unlocks New Applications for Decentralized Data Storage
entry.summary: Mysten Labs Chief Scientist George Danezis joined Decrypt to talk about its new decentralized storage protocol Walrus, which promises to unlock new applications such as AI and social media, thanks to its novel Red Stuff data encoding algorithm.

entry.title: Why Coinbase Sees Crypto as a Bipartisan, 'Purple' Political Issue
entry.summary: Coinbase VP of Corporate and Business Development, Shan Aggarwal, joined Decrypt's Sander Lutz and Liz Napolitano at Messari Mainnet 2024 to discuss the exchange's efforts to grow mainstream crypto adoption—and how the changing political conversation around digital assets is rapidly playing a major role in that.

entry.title: Binance Is Playing Offense—Not Just Defense—Against Crypto Crime, Says Head of Financial Investigations
entry.summary: Nils Anderson Röed, the exchange’s global head of financial investigations, sat down with Decrypt’s Sander Lutz at Messari Mainnet 2024 to discuss how Binance is proactively dismantling criminal networks around the world, the strategy with which the crypto exchange is approaching sensitive conflicts in the Middle East, and more.

entry.title: FOMO HOUR 212 - SEEDPHRASE TALKS ART!
entry.summary: Payrolls Higher than expected, Bitcoin reacts hard. Crypto sank early in the week as Middle East tensions spooked markets. Powell signals two more rate cuts this year. SUI leads L1s again, nears YTD high despite large unlock. Majority of FTX repayments still months away. EIGEN becomes non-transferable, hits $6bn FDV. SEC to appeal Ripple securities law ruling. Visa launches tokenization platform for banks. SWIFT plans digital asset trial in 2025. ByBit launched trading of global stock indices. SPX, GIGA & FWOG hit ATHs, most memes fall. XCOPY to release 250 piece collection on Shape. HBO documentary claims to have identified Satoshi.

entry.title: Altcoins bleed, ByBit launches stock index trading, POCHITA soars
entry.summary: Altcoins sink, BTC dominance nears cycle high. BTC in ‘three blind mice’ downtrend. Tron revenue hits record $577m in Q3. ByBit to launch trading of major stock indices. Franklin Templeton launch fund on APT. SWIFT banks to trial digital assets in 2025. Aerodrome hits $1bn TVL on Base. Cronje calls out Aerodrome for copyright. ETH ICO wallet sells $47m. SEC files appeal against Ripple ruling. EIGEN falls 20% on staking rewards FUD. FTX to auction off WLD position. Half of US voters think crypto ‘important’. North Korea ‘infiltrating’ crypto industry. Snowden challenged over SOL centralisation view. Top SEC official on crypto set to depart.

entry.title: DACOM Summit: Fastex CLO Vardan Khachatryan on Crypto Compliance
entry.summary: Fastex Chief Legal Officer Vardan Khachatryan joined Rug Radio creator Mlow at DACOM Summit to discuss how the crypto exchange is advancing compliance, and the regulatory challenges that lie ahead for the sector.
